001package io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.util;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.extension.Craftsman;
004import java.io.IOException;
005import java.io.InputStream;
006import java.io.UncheckedIOException;
007import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
008import java.util.MissingResourceException;
009
010/**
011 * Utility class for loading resource files such as HTML templates.
012 *
013 * <p>This class provides a method to load an HTML template from the classpath
014 * and return its content as a string.
015 * </p>
016 *
017 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
018 */
019public final class ResourceLoader {
020
021   private ResourceLoader() {
022   }
023
024   /**
025    * Loads an HTML template from the classpath and returns its content as a string.
026    *
027    * <p>The template file should be located within the project's resources directory.
028    * If the file is not found or cannot be read, a {@link RuntimeException} is thrown.
029    * </p>
030    *
031    * @param filePath the name or path of the template file within the classpath
032    * @return the content of the HTML template as a string
033    * @throws RuntimeException if the template file is not found or cannot be read
034    */
035   public static String loadResourceFile(String filePath) {
036      try (InputStream inputStream = getResourceAsStream(filePath)) {
037         if (inputStream == null) {
038            throw new MissingResourceException(
039                  "File not found in resources: " + filePath, ResourceLoader.class.getName(),
040                  filePath);
041         }
042         return new String(inputStream.readAllBytes(), StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
043      } catch (IOException e) {
044         throw new UncheckedIOException("Failed to load file from resources: " + filePath, e);
045      }
046   }
047
048   /**
049    * Retrieves a resource file as an {@link InputStream} from the classpath.
050    *
051    * <p>This method uses the class loader of the {@link Craftsman}
052    * class to locate and open the specified file from the project's resources directory.
053    * It returns {@code null} if the file is not found.
054    * </p>
055    *
056    * @param filePath the name or path of the resource file within the classpath
057    * @return an {@link InputStream} of the resource file, or {@code null} if the file does not exist
058    */
059   static InputStream getResourceAsStream(String filePath) {
060      return Craftsman.class.getClassLoader().getResourceAsStream(filePath);
061   }
062}
